Just got back from the Phoenix Reptile Expo.
Was fun. Lots of ludicrously expensive animals.
I remember going to a flea market in Tupelo. A lady sold exotic pets - like these miniature, thumb size monkeys
$5,000 each
No thumb sized monkeys, but lots of albino and off-color reptiles for similar prices and more.
Saw one going for 15k because it was a female breeder.
Got to hold one of those Pac Man frogs too, funny lookin litter fellers.
little*
I got one
Peeka’s full grown though. They likely had babies
Yeah, s'why I asked to hold one, remembered that was your frog when I passed by a booth with a couple.
$30-$60 across the lot.
I’ve held Peeka before. You just have to be careful about the mouth. They have teeth and don’t believe in letting go
They varied. Some were half dollar circumference, some a bit smaller than my fist.
And always make sure your hands are clean #1
Yeah, that was something the guy mentioned.
Babies (that aren’t tadpoles) are about quarter to half dollar size
Little angry beady eyes
So precious
He knew which one of them was "the chill one"
I got Peeka from a girl who was getting rid of a few exotics because she was moving. She didn’t even know Peeka was a girl, let alone had bothered giving her a name
Another booth was trying to sell a giant water monitor for $200 (super cheap). Asked him why the price was so low. "Because he's a little turd and I'm tired of dealing with his drama."
“Reason for sale: he’s a little sh$&”
He was a big boi. About 5 and a half feet snout to tip.
And something I’ve seen about frogs in general is that what they amount to be is a mouth with just enough leg to launch said mouth at food

"Their saliva meets the definition of a venom since it is toxic to small prey such as frogs and toads; however, it is not likely to cause serious injury to humans, particularly as hognoses are rear-fanged"
They have a sedative-like bite yeah

But not like the copperhead or water moccasin
They’re legal

bite
